input_text:
Job Title: Actuarial Technician, Illustrations

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary

This position is responsible for providing expert product advice/support in the process of executing new products or any enhancements to existing products. This position is also responsible for maintaining a thorough understanding of life and annuity products, business platforms, and providing ongoing support of retail projects and initiatives. Responsibilities are inclusive of product training, development of product supporting checking tools and administrative system verification to ensure product integrity is achieved.

This position will be part of the Retail Operations Distribution Implementation Team.

Duties And Responsibilities

Under minimal supervision utilize product configuration tools to setup new products and make changes to existing productsDevelop testing plans utilizing internal documentation such as product specs and specimen contracts to assure all relevant features are validatedComplete testing of the product and product features on illustration platforms and sales toolsAssist with the crafting of UI and Output BRDsUnder supervision assist in development of illustration software spec and BRD documentationUnder supervision assist in development of checking tools & calculators used to support product/ridersAs workload permits – assist in validation in other areas (i.e. administration system, policy page print)May periodically lead development on smaller projects

Experience And Education Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required – Preferred in Mathematics, Actuarial Science or related technical fieldLife insurance and annuity product knowledge is preferred with preference for Indexed UL and Fixed Indexed Annuity experienceStrong technical, analytical, organizational, computer, and team skills.Experience in the financial services industry

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Ability to perform in a fast-paced production environment with moderate direction while addressing multiple projects and responsibilitiesProficient in Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)Proficient with spreadsheet applications and working knowledge of Visual Basic or related applications.Must be extremely detail oriented, analytical and be able handle multiple projectsAbility to proactively communicate and work with all groups in the organizationTeam player with demonstrated ability to proactively identify issuesTeam player with demonstrated ability to proactively identify issues and to influence key project decisions to achieve desired outcomesSelf-starter who demonstrates strong initiative and is able to operate efficiently in unpredictable and challenging project environmentsAbility to interact with personnel at all levels of the organization in both technical and business areas successfullyExcellent verbal, written, interpersonal, and presentation skills

Other Requirements

Perform other functions, duties and projects as assignedRegular and punctual attendanceOccasional travel may be required (less than 10%)Typical professional office environment with periods of extended sitting required

Additional Information

Work Environments

F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.

F&G complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and candidates with disabilities, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship for F&G. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact talentacquisition@fglife.com.

Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers

About F&G

Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.

As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.

1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 

2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022 

Notice for all Applicants who are California residents under the California Privacy Rights Act. Please click here to review the policy.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
